breakfast.title: Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Greek Yogurt
breakfast.description: Protein-rich Indian-inspired savory pancakes made with besan (chickpea flour) served with spiced Greek yogurt
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: Mix chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt in a bowl
2. **Add liquid**: Gradually whisk in water to form smooth batter, let rest 5 minutes
3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat olive oil in non-stick pan, pour batter to make 3 pancakes, cook 3-4 minutes each side
4. **Prepare yogurt**: Mix Greek yogurt with chopped coriander and pinch of salt
5. **Serve**: Top pancakes with spiced yogurt and sprinkle with oats

lunch.title: Thai-Style Grilled Tofu with Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
lunch.description: Spicy grilled tofu with aromatic herbs served over a fresh Mediterranean quinoa salad
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse and cook quinoa in 160ml water for 15 minutes, let cool
2. **Marinate tofu**: Cut tofu into slabs, mix curry paste with 10ml olive oil and lime juice, marinate tofu 10 minutes
3. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill pan, cook tofu 4-5 minutes each side until charred
4. **Prepare salad**: Dice tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper; mix with quinoa
5. **Make dressing**: Whisk remaining olive oil, lime juice, chili flakes
6. **Assemble**: Toss salad with dressing, herbs, and crumbled feta; serve with sliced grilled tofu

dinner.title: Spicy Indian-Italian Fusion Eggplant Curry with Polenta
dinner.description: Aromatic eggplant curry with Indian spices served over creamy Italian polenta with Mediterranean herbs
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare vegetables**: Cube eggplant and paneer, dice onion, mince garlic and ginger
2. **Start polenta**: Bring 300ml broth to boil, gradually whisk in polenta, simmer 20 minutes stirring frequently
3. **Cook curry base**: Heat olive oil, sauté onion, garlic, ginger until fragrant
4. **Add spices**: Add garam masala, paprika, cayenne, cook 1 minute
5. **Build curry**: Add eggplant, cook 8 minutes; add tomatoes, coconut milk, simmer 10 minutes
6. **Add paneer**: Gently fold in paneer cubes, cook 5 minutes
7. **Finish polenta**: Stir in parmesan and oregano, season with salt
8. **Serve**: Spoon curry over creamy polenta, garnish with fresh oregano

breakfast.title: Spiced Mediterranean Chickpea Scramble with Gluten-Free Toast
breakfast.description: A protein-packed vegetarian breakfast with aromatic Indian and Mediterranean spices, served with gluten-free toast
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prep ingredients**: Drain and rinse chickpeas, dice onion and bell pepper, halve cherry tomatoes

2. **Heat oil**: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat

3. **Sauté vegetables**: Add onion and bell pepper, cook for 3-4 minutes until softened

4. **Add spices**: Add turmeric, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant

5. **Add chickpeas**: Add chickpeas and mash lightly with a fork, leaving some texture. Cook for 3-4 minutes

6. **Add greens**: Add spinach and cherry tomatoes, cook until spinach wilts

7. **Finish and serve**: Top with crumbled feta cheese and serve with toasted gluten-free bread

lunch.title: Thai-Style Spicy Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
lunch.description: Marinated grilled tofu with Thai spices served over fragrant coconut rice with vegetables
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare tofu**: Press tofu to remove excess water, then cut into thick slabs

2. **Make marinade**: Mix soy sauce, lime juice, red curry paste, minced ginger, garlic, and chili flakes

3. **Marinate tofu**: Marinate tofu in the mixture for 10 minutes

4. **Cook rice**: Cook jasmine rice with coconut milk and water (1:1 ratio) until fluffy

5. **Grill tofu**: Heat coconut oil in a grill pan, grill marinated tofu for 3-4 minutes per side until golden

6. **Steam vegetables**: Steam broccoli and snap peas until tender-crisp

7. **Assemble**: Serve grilled tofu over coconut rice with steamed vegetables, garnish with fresh cilantro

dinner.title: Indian-Spiced Grilled Paneer with Mediterranean Quinoa Pilaf
dinner.description: Aromatic grilled paneer with warming Indian spices served alongside a Mediterranean-inspired quinoa pilaf
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare spice mix**: Combine garam masala, coriander, cumin, paprika, and cayenne with Greek yogurt

2. **Marinate paneer**: Cut paneer into thick pieces and marinate in spice mixture for 15 minutes

3. **Prepare quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and toast in a dry pan for 2 minutes until fragrant

4. **Cook pilaf**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil, sauté diced red onion and zucchini for 3 minutes

5. **Add quinoa**: Add toasted quinoa and vegetable broth, bring to boil, then simmer covered for 15 minutes

6. **Grill paneer**: Heat remaining olive oil in grill pan, grill marinated paneer for 2-3 minutes per side

7. **Finish pilaf**: Stir chopped sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and mint into cooked quinoa

8. **Serve**: Plate quinoa pilaf topped with grilled paneer pieces

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich, savory gluten-free pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water until smooth. Add turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and salt.

2. **Add vegetables**: Mix in chopped onion, tomato, green chilies, and cilantro. Let batter rest for 10 minutes.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour 1/3 of batter to make a thin pancake. Cook for 2-3 minutes until golden.

4. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully and cook another 2 minutes. Repeat for remaining batter.

5. **Serve**: Serve hot with Greek yogurt on the side.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Colorful grilled vegetables over quinoa with tahini dressing and feta cheese
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth according to package directions (about 15 minutes).

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Toss sliced vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper.

3. **Grill vegetables**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill vegetables for 3-4 minutes per side until tender and charred.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and 1 tbsp olive oil with 2 tbsp water until smooth.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Serve grilled vegetables over quinoa, top with crumbled feta and drizzle with tahini dressing.

dinner.title: Thai-Inspired Spicy Eggplant and Tofu Stir-Fry with Rice
dinner.description: Savory and spicy Thai-style stir-fry with crispy tofu, eggplant, and jasmine rice
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook rice**: Prepare jasmine rice according to package directions.

2. **Prepare tofu**: Press tofu to remove moisture, then cube. Heat 1 tbsp coconut oil in a large wok and fry tofu until golden. Remove and set aside.

3. **Cook eggplant**: Add 1 tbsp oil to wok and stir-fry eggplant slices until tender, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.

4. **Make sauce**: In remaining oil, sauté garlic, ginger, and chilies for 30 seconds. Add curry paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in coconut milk, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice.

5. **Combine**: Return tofu and eggplant to wok. Add bell pepper and stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Add Thai basil and green onions, cook 1 minute more.

6. **Serve**: Serve immediately over jasmine rice.

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes made with chickpea flour and spiced with Indian seasonings
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Make the batter**: In a large bowl, whisk together chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin powder, chili powder, and salt.

2. **Add liquid**: Gradually add water while whisking to create a smooth, lump-free batter. Let rest for 5 minutes.

3. **Add vegetables**: Stir in chopped onion, tomato, and fresh coriander.

4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tsp oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour 1/3 of batter and spread evenly. Cook for 2-3 minutes until golden.

5. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully and cook another 2 minutes. Repeat for remaining batter.

6. **Serve**: Serve hot with Greek yogurt on the side for extra protein and cooling effect.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Colorful grilled vegetables over protein-rich quinoa with Mediterranean herbs and feta cheese
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth according to package directions (about 15 minutes).

2. **Prep vegetables**: Slice all vegetables into even pieces. Toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, and salt.

3. **Preheat grill**: Heat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.

4. **Grill vegetables**: Grill vegetables for 3-4 minutes per side until tender and lightly charred.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Place cooked quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables.

6. **Finish and serve**: Crumble feta cheese over top, drizzle with remaining olive oil and lemon juice, garnish with fresh basil.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
dinner.description: Marinated and grilled tofu with aromatic Thai spices served over creamy coconut rice with vegetables
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Press and slice tofu**: Press tofu to remove excess water, then cut into thick slabs. Slice into grillable pieces.

2. **Make marinade**: Whisk together soy sauce, lime juice, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, curry paste, and brown sugar.

3. **Marinate tofu**: Marinate tofu in half the sauce for at least 15 minutes.

4. **Cook rice**: Combine rice, coconut milk, and water in a pot. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer 18 minutes.

5. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill or grill pan. Grill marinated tofu 4-5 minutes per side until nicely charred.

6. **Sauté vegetables**: Heat coconut oil in a large pan. Stir-fry bell pepper, snap peas, and carrots for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.

7. **Combine and serve**: Toss vegetables with remaining marinade. Serve grilled tofu over coconut rice with sautéed vegetables. Garnish with cilantro and lime wedges.

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water until smooth. Add turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt.

2. **Add vegetables**: Finely chop onion, tomato, and green chili. Mix into batter with cilantro.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in non-stick pan. Pour half batter, spread evenly. Cook 3-4 minutes until golden, flip and cook 2-3 minutes more.

4. **Repeat**: Make second pancake with remaining batter and oil.

5. **Serve**: Serve hot with toasted gluten-free bread on the side.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Eggplant and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Savory grilled eggplant with herb-infused quinoa and tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 2 cups water for 15 minutes until fluffy.

2. **Prepare eggplant**: Slice eggplant into rounds, brush with 2 tbsp olive oil, season with salt, oregano, and paprika.

3. **Grill eggplant**: Grill on medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side until tender and charred.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, red pepper flakes, and 1 tbsp olive oil.

5. **Prepare vegetables**: Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, chop parsley.

6. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa, grilled eggplant, chickpeas, vegetables. Drizzle with tahini dressing.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Italian Herb Rice
dinner.description: Fusion dish with Thai-marinated grilled tofu and savory Italian herb rice
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate tofu**: Press and cube tofu. Marinate in coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chili flakes for 15 minutes.

2. **Cook rice**: Cook jasmine rice in vegetable broth with dried basil and oregano until tender, about 18 minutes.

3. **Prepare vegetables**: Slice bell pepper and zucchini into strips.

4. **Grill tofu**: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in grill pan. Grill marinated tofu cubes for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and crispy.

5. **Sauté vegetables**: In same pan, sauté bell pepper and zucchini with remaining oil for 5-6 minutes until tender.

6. **Finish rice**: Stir nutritional yeast into cooked rice for extra protein and umami flavor.

7. **Serve**: Plate herb rice topped with grilled tofu and sautéed vegetables.

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water until smooth. Let rest for 10 minutes.

2. **Add spices**: Mix in turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt.

3. **Prepare vegetables**: Finely chop onion, tomato, green chili, and cilantro. Add to batter.

4. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tsp oil in non-stick pan. Pour 1/3 of batter, spread thin. Cook 3-4 minutes until golden.

5. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully, cook 2-3 minutes more. Repeat for remaining batter.

6. **Serve**: Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Grilled Mediterranean vegetables with quinoa and feta cheese
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth for 15 minutes until fluffy.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Cut zucchini, bell pepper, eggplant, and onion into large chunks.

3. **Season vegetables**: Toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, and salt.

4. **Grill vegetables**: Grill on medium-high heat for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally until tender and charred.

5. **Make dressing**: Whisk remaining olive oil with lemon juice.

6. **Assemble bowl**: Serve quinoa topped with grilled vegetables, crumbled feta, and dressing.

dinner.title: Spicy Thai-Style Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
dinner.description: Marinated grilled tofu with fragrant coconut rice and Thai flavors
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Press tofu**: Drain and press tofu for 15 minutes, then cut into thick slabs.

2. **Make marinade**: Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, ginger, chili flakes, lime juice, and brown sugar.

3. **Marinate tofu**: Marinate tofu in mixture for 15 minutes, turning once.

4. **Cook rice**: Combine rice, coconut milk, water, and salt. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer covered 18 minutes.

5. **Grill tofu**: Heat olive oil in grill pan. Grill tofu 4-5 minutes per side until golden and charred.

6. **Finish and serve**: Fluff rice, top with grilled tofu, sliced green onions, and fresh basil. Drizzle with remaining marinade.

breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Mix the batter**: In a bowl, combine chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water while whisking to avoid lumps.

2. **Add vegetables**: Fold in diced tomatoes, onions, and cilantro into the batter.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a non-stick pan. Pour half the batter and spread evenly. Cook for 3-4 minutes until golden.

4. **Flip and finish**: Flip carefully and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter.

5. **Serve**: Toast the gluten-free bread with remaining oil and serve alongside the chillas.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Smoky grilled vegetables with herbs over protein-packed quinoa
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prep vegetables**: Cut zucchini, peppers, and eggplant into thick slices. Halve cherry tomatoes.

3. **Season**: Toss vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, and salt.

4. **Grill**: Heat grill or grill pan to medium-high. Grill vegetables for 4-5 minutes per side until charred and tender.

5. **Assemble**: Serve grilled vegetables over quinoa, top with crumbled feta, fresh basil, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil.

dinner.title: Thai-Style Spicy Grilled Tofu with Coconut Rice
dinner.description: Marinated grilled tofu with fragrant coconut jasmine rice and Thai herbs
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate tofu**: Press tofu and cut into thick slabs. Mix soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, minced garlic, ginger, curry paste, and 1 tbsp sesame oil. Marinate tofu for 30 minutes.

2. **Cook rice**: Combine rice, coconut milk, and water in a pot. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 18 minutes.

3. **Grill tofu**: Heat grill or grill pan. Grill marinated tofu for 4-5 minutes per side until charred. Reserve marinade.

4. **Prepare vegetables**: Stir-fry green beans with remaining sesame oil for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.

5. **Serve**: Plate coconut rice, top with grilled tofu and green beans. Drizzle with reserved marinade, garnish with Thai basil, cilantro, and lime wedges.
